pull.title: doc: Clarify rpcwallet flag url change
pull.body: This adds clarification to the bitcoin-cli -rpcwallet flag in the help command. This will benefit users who want to utilize this feature without the cli, for example curl. It isn't readily apparent that this changes the url used in the RPC call.

events.body: Agree with @promag, IMO this isn't the right place to put such an example, it would be better in some other documentation not in bitcoin-cli help text

I agree, maybe `doc/RPC-interface.md` is a better solution, the only problem is that many users will not know about the new doc. Perhaps the incentive to dig a little is great enough. I wonder if the `doc/RPC-interface.md` would be too difficult to maintain, e.g. the manpages are is generated deterministically.

rename.to: doc: Clarify rpcwallet flag url change

comments.body: Is this relevant from the `bitcoin-cli` user's point of view? At least I'd drop the `e.g. ...` part here.
I'm not sure the best place for this, but I think an example url would be helpful somewhere. There are curl examples for each command help, but not for any of the flags.

I disagree with meshcollider and promag, and think this information is useful. Or at least I don't understand how it harms anyone. I hate documentation that just gives me a handwavy gloss about how an option is intended to be used without saying what it actually does.

Of course it would also be good to document wallet endpoints in markdown. There is some text in the [0.15.0 release notes](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/release-notes/release-notes-0.15.0.md#multi-wallet-support) ("HTTP RPC requests should be send to the...") that could be moved to [JSON-RPC-interface.md](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/JSON-RPC-interface.md). This could be done here or in a separate PR. I actually remember complaining about lack of API documentation when this feature was first added https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10849#issuecomment-315731689, and I guess it still doesn't exist.

I generally don't think the option help is the place to put very detailed specifications (just like the release notes are not !), but in this case I kind of like it because it's short and directly illustrates what it does.
